intro: Stengelia insignis, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its rosette of velvety, dark green leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white. The plant is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is known for its compact growth habit and ability to thrive in shaded environments. Stengelia insignis is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively low maintenance requirements. It prefers well-draining soil and consistent moisture, making it a favorite among indoor gardeners.
